result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 12-23-15 or civil judgment shall be imposed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Michael McLemore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jermaine Michael McLemore
Current: 4107 W Nash Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206-2960 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2017)
Prior: 4107 W Meinecke Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 (three) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by December 23, 2015 or civil judgment shall be imposed.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.

Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.   
Pretrial conference held. Defense counsel has not received discovery and offer.  Parties requesting an adjournment. Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference, Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jermaine Michael McLemore not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
